intro: Lysidice, commonly known as the white wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa. Lysidice typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
